result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley N. Bird was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ashley N. Bird is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ashley N. Bird was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 04:25 PM Defendant Ashley N. Bird in court with attorney Jeffrey Ocwieja.  Defendant Ashley N. Bird in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court makes record of current case status and recites recommendations of the DOC.  State advises there is a stipulation on the recommendation as made by DOC.  Ct 1:  30 days jail w/ Huber.  Concurrent to all other cases and 136 days credit (on each case).    Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 16, 2019 at 04:15 pm.
to Judge Koehler from Atty. Ocwieja
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

Defendant Ashley N. Bird in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites joint recommendation:  Ct 1: dismissed.  Ct 2:  W/H - 24 mo probation - counseling by DOC; AODA; costs.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  NC plea given/entered.    Defendant sworn by the Clerk.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for further time.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
